Name: Hexfactory
About the game: Build and protect cities with factories in an infinite hex world. Best way to play the game: Singleplayer / Mouse and Keyboard. Balance production and consumption of your city. Research new technologies, Build more factories, Build more cities, Explore new tiles and new planets, Protect your cities from alien sabotage, Use the Map Maker to build your own worlds, Get Steam Achievements, Compare with other players with the Steam Leaderboards! Multiplayer Online Stock Exchange. Reach tier 5 to be able to trade items in the Stock Market with other players online in real-time. Features in this prototype: 41 Initial Buildings (Build Roads, Miners, Farms, Factories, Houses and Services) 15 Initial types of Tiles 7 Research areas 2 Citizen class 1 Alien Saboteur class 1 Spaceship class 39 Parts to produce 2 Planets (Earth and Moon) Terraforming Testing phase of the Online Stock Market Some thoughts for the next versions of the game: + new Buildings (More factories, farms, power generators, miners...) + new tile types (Desert, uranium, pasture, bauxite, oil...) + parts to produce ( Canned Food, Tools, Satellites, Smartphones...) + Citizen Classes (Engineers, Scientists, Ecologists...) + types of houses + types of services (Health Center, School, Stadium...) Manual Turrets, Automatic Turrets and Spaceship to fight new enemies And more thoughts... Add a Character Start adding content to the wiki on \fandom Create all the story of the game Make new planets and travelling Add supply pods Manual and Automatic turrets to defend your cities Spaceships to defend your cities Sandbox mode New missions to produce/atack/dominate new places More decorations Mod support using Steam Workshop Sell and buy items in-game (send them to other planets) This is a passion project that will go on for a long time. I'm a solo developer who also makes mods for Satisfactory and Factorio. Aquila Industrial - Satisfactory Mods DellAquila - Factorio Mods Music by JuliusH from Pixabay Italian translation by Micol Pennese Portuguese translation by Andre Aquila German translation by Astradaha
